name: Alfred Hitchcock
description: British director, 'Master of Suspense', known for 'Psycho', 'Rear Window', and revolutionizing the thriller genre.

name: Steven Spielberg
description: American director, pioneering figure in modern blockbuster filmmaking, with iconic films like 'Jaws', 'E.T.', and 'Schindler's List'.

name: Martin Scorsese
description: American director, storyteller of crime and passion, known for 'Taxi Driver', 'Goodfellas', and 'The Wolf of Wall Street'.

name: Akira Kurosawa
description: Japanese filmmaker, master of samurai epics, known for 'Seven Samurai', 'Rashomon', and influencing Western cinema.

name: Stanley Kubrick
description: American director, known for intellectual depth in films like '2001: A Space Odyssey', 'The Shining', and 'A Clockwork Orange'.

name: Federico Fellini
description: Italian director, known for his distinct style in 'La Dolce Vita', '8Â½', blending fantasy with baroque images.

name: Quentin Tarantino
description: American director, renowned for stylized films with sharp dialogue and action, including 'Pulp Fiction' and 'Kill Bill'.

name: Francis Ford Coppola
description: American director, known for the epic 'Godfather' trilogy and 'Apocalypse Now', blending dramatic storytelling with bold visuals.

name: Woody Allen
description: American director, blending comedy, romance, and existential questions in films like 'Annie Hall' and 'Manhattan'.

name: Ingmar Bergman
description: Swedish director, known for exploring mortality and loneliness in films like 'The Seventh Seal' and 'Wild Strawberries'.

name: Zhang Yimou
description: Chinese director, known for visually stunning works like 'Hero', 'House of Flying Daggers', blending traditional stories with epic cinematography.

name: Ang Lee
description: Taiwanese director, versatile in style, known for 'Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon', 'Brokeback Mountain', and 'Life of Pi'.
